org.apache.twill.api

Interface TwillRunResources


  • public interface TwillRunResources
    Information about the container the TwillRunnable is running in.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getContainerId() 
      Integer getDebugPort() 
      String getHost() 
      int getInstanceId() 
      LogEntry.Level getLogLevel()
      Deprecated. 
      Use getLogLevels() to get the log levels map and get root level from the map instead.
      Map<String,LogEntry.Level> getLogLevels() 
      int getMaxHeapMemoryMB() 
      int getMemoryMB() 
      int getVirtualCores() 

    • Method Detail

      • getInstanceId

        int getInstanceId()
        Returns:
        instance id of the runnable.

      • getVirtualCores

        int getVirtualCores()
        Returns:
        number of cores the runnable is allowed to use. YARN must be at least v2.1.0 and it must be configured to use cgroups in order for this to be a reflection of truth.

      • getMemoryMB

        int getMemoryMB()
        Returns:
        amount of memory in MB the runnable is allowed to use.

      • getMaxHeapMemoryMB

        int getMaxHeapMemoryMB()
        Returns:
        the maximum amount of memory in MB of Java process heap memory.

      • getHost

        String getHost()
        Returns:
        the host the runnable is running on.

      • getContainerId

        String getContainerId()
        Returns:
        id of the container the runnable is running in.

      • getDebugPort

        Integer getDebugPort()
        Returns:
        the debug port of the container's JVM, or null if not debug-enabled.

      • getLogLevel

        @Deprecated
LogEntry.Level getLogLevel()
        Deprecated. Use getLogLevels() to get the log levels map and get root level from the map instead.
        Returns:
        the enabled log level for the container where the runnable is running in.

      • getLogLevels

        Map<String,LogEntry.Level> getLogLevels()
        Returns:
        the enabled log level arguments for the container where the runnable is running in.
